segments.text: Oh no, look at that sink; water is just gushing out everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes but she has no idea about the flood happening right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the puddle already, and the floor must be so slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can imagine her slipping and falling hard on those wet tiles.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there's that boy on the stool; it's tilting backward dangerously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If it tips, he'll come crashing down with cookies flying everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is right there too, reaching up, so she might get hurt as well.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked from the overflow; this could ruin everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden looks so peaceful, totally unaware of the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, which is cute but so risky right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just begging for an accident to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
